constraints: Completeness ("full"): The response provides a thorough answer for normal use, covering all major aspects without needing every micro-detail.

Scope ("time"): The response focuses on when things occur and how they change over time—sequences, evolution, history, phases, or temporal dynamics—rather than static structure, evaluation, or immediate action.

Channel ("adr"): The response takes the shape of an Architecture Decision Record (ADR) document with sections for context, decision, and consequences, formatted as a structured document ready for version control.
